revised_title: Free Convection Effects on Oscillatory Flow Past a Vertical Porous Plate: A Study on Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer
tldr: This study investigates the effects of free convection on the oscillatory flow past an infinite, vertical, porous plate with constant suction. The research focuses on the transient velocity and temperature profiles, skin friction, and heat transfer rates. The findings show that free convection currents can cause reversed flow types and affect the amplitude and phase of skin friction. The rate of heat transfer increases with greater heating or cooling of the plate, with a higher impact when the plate is cooled.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
